pageHeader.subtitle: Large Scale Interactive Installation in Paris.
pageHeader.description: > Developed in response to the 911 atrocities, Chronopolis was a large-scale interactive projection installation that was presented in Paris at the La Villette Numerique festival.  Chronolopis was a conceptual city represented by a graphic clock. This fictional place existed in between standard and metric time. Responding to the gathering of people on the floor, a computer measured the population to interpret the effect that the population has on the perception of time.

projectInfo.results: Presented at the Design designer(s) exhibition, part of the 'Lille World Design Capital 2020'.
